description._content: Title: Juan Vela [condemned murderer] Creator: Unknown Date: 1866 Part Of: Lawrence T. Jones III Texas photography collection Description: Juan Vela was one of three Cortinistas condemned for murder during Juan Cortina's 1859 raid in Brownsville, Texas. This portrait of Vela was taken shortly before his execution on June 22, 1866. Because of the poor light in the prison where he was photographed, the image was heavily retouched to show his hair and beard. The photographer was likely to be Louis de Planque or R. H. Wallis. Physical Description: 1 photographic print on carte de visite mount; 10 x 6 cm. Form/Genre: Cartes de visite; Photographs; Portrait photographs File: federal_army-1-08c.tif Rights: Please cite Southern Methodist University, Central University Libraries, DeGolyer Library when using this image file. A high-quality version of this file may be obtained for a fee by contacting degolyer@smu.edu. For more information, see: digitalcollections.smu.edu/u?/jtx,266 View Lawrence T. Jones III Texas Photographs at: digitalcollections.smu.edu/all/cul/jtx/
